title: Simple Machines Make Life Easier for Poor Farmers

tasks.task: Develop and test a hand-held planting tool for small-scale farmers.
subtasks: Fabricate a long metal hoe with two flat teeth.
Ensure one tooth plants a seed while the other adds fertilizer with each stroke.
Conduct field tests to assess the tool's efficiency compared to hand planting.
Compare the tool's performance in terms of time saved, seed, and fertilizer usage.
Optimize the design to reduce production costs, aiming for a lower cost than the current $200.
Iterate through multiple versions (fourth version) to refine the tool's effectiveness.

tasks.task: Publish plans for the tool online after completion.
subtasks: Share detailed instructions via the International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center's website.
